Project.name: AsyncCommand Utility for Haxe
Project.Description: The AsyncCommand utility offers a solution to the problem of executing a series of commands each of which may need to complete one or more asynchronous operations before the next command is executed.
Project.ReleaseNotes:
Features in Version 1.0
  • A port of the AsyncCommand Utility for ActionScript 3
  • IAsyncCommand interface defines the methods required for an asynchronous command, which at the moment is only setOnComplete, which sets a callback method for the IAsyncCommand implementer to call when it has completed its task.
  • AsyncCommand class extends the framework SimpleCommand class and implements IAsyncCommand.
  • AsyncMacroCommand class extends Notifier and implements IAsyncCommand. Accepts IAsyncCommands or ICommands for subcommands. This means any combination of SimpleCommand, MacroCommand, AsyncCommand or AsyncMacroCommand.
  • Standard and MultiCore versions are included.
Project.Installation:
Prerequisites
  • You must have Haxe 2 installed.
Installing the Project Source Code From the archive
  • Download the latest source code archive
  • Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance:
    • c:\development\
  • You will see a AsyncCommand_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance:
c:\development\AsyncCommand_X_Y From the Repository
  • Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
